thread.title: Torrential Rain Hits Guwahati During Kali Puja and Diwali Celebrations | Guwahati News - Times of India
thread.title_full: Torrential Rain Hits Guwahati During Kali Puja and Diwali Celebrations | Guwahati News - Times of India

author: Kangkan Kalita
title: Torrential Rain Hits Guwahati During Kali Puja and Diwali Celebrations | Guwahati News - Times of India
text: Guwahati: Weather took an unexpected turn post-monsoon with torrential rain battering Guwahati and its periphery, as well as several parts of the northeast, on Kali Puja and Diwali. Meteorological officials explained that moisture incursion from the Bay of Bengal is triggering such precipitation, noting that conditions will ameliorate. An upper air cyclonic circulation hovers over northeast Assam in lower tropospheric levels.Although the rainfall was moderate, it partially subdued the enthusiasm of shoppers in the markets during the morning hours on Thursday. The IMD on Thursday indicated that light to moderate precipitation is highly probable at several locations across Arunachal Pradesh and Assam on Friday. Concurrently, light rain is anticipated at isolated spots over Meghalaya, Nagaland, and Manipur, whilst dry conditions are expected to prevail over Mizoram and Tripura.We also published the following articles recentlyLight rain likely on Kali PujaOn Oct 31, Kali Puja day, Kolkata may experience light drizzles, but no heavy rain, as per meteorologists. A high-pressure zone over the Bay of Bengal is causing intermittent, light drizzles. Clouds will form sporadically but are not intense enough for heavy rain. The skies are expected to clear quickly, with minimal chances of further rain.114741846Kolkata faces severe waterlogging as Cyclone Dana brings torrential rainLarge areas of Kolkata were severely waterlogged following torrential rains from cyclone Dana, with over 100 mm of rainfall recorded. Key locations, including Bhawanipur and New Market, faced significant traffic disruption. Flooding affected Kolkata Municipal Corporation headquarters and SSKM Hospital. The civic body is deploying resources to manage drainage amidst challenges from high tide and continuous rain.114577642Met predicts light rain in run-up to Kali PujaKolkata is expected to have intermittent light rain and cloudy skies leading up to Kali Puja on October 31, due to a high-pressure zone over the Bay of Bengal. This has brought moisture, resulting in sporadic rain showers. Recent weather included light drizzle and minor rain following Cyclone Dana, with temperatures reaching up to 31.5C.114698820
